page.title: 04The Old School
page.content: The School St.School was known as the Village School or The Dump.The actual building would be celebrating its 175th anniversary this year. Built in 1814 at a total cost of Â£700, the school was mortgaged to a Phoebe Webb of Church Lawford.She lent Â£246 in total,at an interest rate of 5%. A will dated 11th July 1799 belonging to Edward Abbott of Hillmorton left a legacy,the interest of which was to pay for the instruction of twelve poor children of the parish.This was to teach them reading,writing and arithmetic.Edward Abbott insisted that only four were to learn to write and do arithmetic at one time.The other eight would read.If a child was away for more than 4 days without a good reason,he was struck off the list.The schoolmaster was paid only for time spent in school,not school holidays.
